snippet: By positioning Michael Bradley as essentially a third forward, Jurgen Klinsmann is gambling that higher scoring will offset the possibility that more goals will be conceded.
abstract: United States men's soccer team’s chances of advancing to the knockout phase at 2014 World Cup in Brazil could be determined in large part on just how far coach Jurgen Klinsmann dares to push midfielder Michael Bradley forward; by positioning Bradley as essentially a third forward, Klinsmann is gambling that higher scoring will offset the possibility that more goals will be conceded.
lead_paragraph: By positioning Michael Bradley as essentially a third forward, Jurgen Klinsmann is gambling that higher scoring will offset the possibility that more goals will be conceded.

headline.seo: Jurgen Klinsmann Gambles on Michael Bradley’s Scoring Prowess for U.S. Soccer
headline.main: A U.S. Midfielder Goes on the Offensive
headline.print_headline: A U.S. Midfielder Goes on the Offensive

keywords.value: United States Men's National Soccer Team
